title: How to change “Bye!” into a passive voice - Quora

response.answer_text: Your question is a good comeback to the formalists who claim that a sentence must have a subject and a verb. [I usually answer them by saying “Yeah, sure.”] To be changeable to passive construction, a sentence must have [at least] a transitive verb and a direct or indirect object. “Bye!” has no verb.

It wouldn't really be done in English as there is no obvious subject/object. In some other languages the form for “goodbye” is more complex. So, for example, in Polish and German it basically means “until we meet again”. If you really wanted to make a goodbye into passive in English you would probably have to make it longer, “I wish you goodbye”: “You wished goodbye” but it sounds very strange.
